title: MessageBodyWriter not selected went no Accept header is set
body:
### Describe the bug

In the recent Quarkus patch version ( >= `3.11.2`) we noticed a change in behaviour in how MessageBodyWriter selection occurred when the HTTP `Accept` header is not set. When the header is not present our custom MessageBodyWriter will no longer be selected and applied for the response.

This change in behaviour seems like a bug.

### Expected behavior

Even if the `Accept` header was not set is should default to the most appropriate MessageBodyWriter.

### Actual behavior

When the `Accept` header is not set is will default to and internal default MessageBodyWriter.

One solution to this is to add a `@Produces` annotation to the custom  MessageBodyWriter but this seems like duplication as its on the endpoint:
![image](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/assets/1751613/c873da13-c59c-4d98-a1e7-3238bfdb45a5)


### How to Reproduce?

Clone: https://github.com/jholleran/message-body-writer-selection
Run: `./mvnw clean test`
The tests that fail reproduce this issue.

Changing the `quarkus.platform.version` to 3.11.1 in the pom.xml and the tests will now pass


### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

Linux triton 6.1.0-1029-oem #29-Ubuntu SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Tue Jan  9 21:07:34 UTC 2024 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

### Output of `java -version`

17.0.11

### Quarkus version or git rev

_No response_

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Apache Maven 3.9.6 (bc0240f3c744dd6b6ec2920b3cd08dcc295161ae)

### Additional information

This change in behaviour seems to have been caused by this change: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/41111
